metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5581 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in tif_dir.c in LibTIFF before 4.0.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted DOTRANGE tag in a TIFF image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.2-4ubuntu2
libtiff-tools - 4.0.2-4ubuntu2
libtiff5 - 4.0.2-4ubuntu2
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.2-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.2-4ubuntu2').
